You didn’t wait for the image to upload successfully , we can’t see the image

I think you might be interested in trying out the most recent version of my action: https://github.com/potiuk/cancel-workflow-runs/releases/tag/v4_1  - we had a lot of problems recently with huge queues and delays (separate issue discussed in builds@apache.org) but one of the problems we've hit was that the canceling was not "aggresive" enough for duplicates in case there were many builds queued.

The most recent release of my action solves that problem I believe. I not only improved/cleaned/documented the code, but I also implemented "allDuplicates" cancel mode, that works in the way that single pass of even hours long "workflow_run" action, cancels all duplicates - no matter if they are "older" than the run or "more recent". The action always leaves only the most recent run from each "branch" (no matter what branch it is) and cancels all other. I would love to hear if that helps in your case.

More info about the whole approach and motivation we've taken can be read here: https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/PULL_REQUEST_WORKFLOW.rst so you might also want to see if there is anything in our approach that can help you.

Happy to help if needed.
I found the dependency circle problem, the core module remote manager dependency on cluster module, when called start method

still have the toolkit problem

> @kezhenxu94 Is coverage failing?

Just pushed a commit not to fail the CI if and only if codecov failed
@moonsphere I have a direct talk with PingCap's friends, right now, as a minor change, this deletion way seems the best choice.

@xbkaishui If you have time and interest to follow this, I want to provide a more complex brief on what is the better way.

First of all, #5754 should be accepted, as it is a minor change and has low risk but fixed the issue quickly.
Then, after the deep discussion with PingCap, I think we could do
1. Create several physical tables for one logical entity in the OAP
1. Set a view to represent the logical entity.
1. Make the metrics data rolling with a certain order, such as `(time bucket - 19700101) mod size`.
1. TTL timer chooses the oldest physical table and does `truncate`(according to PingCAP, `truncate = drop + create table`)

Could you run a POC locally, especially on
1. `CREATE VIEW v1 AS SELECT * FROM t1, t2, t3`, table t1, t2, t3 include time bucket and entity id.
1. Run `group by` to get `top N` and `avg` from the view.
In theory, TiDB should support that, but we should check it before really change many things.

FYI @moonsphere This will be a big improvement, also, it will take time. So, please, help on landing your PR first :) Don't wait for this.
@potiuk We are going to land this on the master branch :) Thanks for providing this cool thing.

I've also added few more things today - including self-preservation mechanism (v4_4) after some edge cases we discovered in Airflow. I am looking at our experiences and in case I find any problems I am fixing it rather quickly - so let me know if you experience any problems. The way I am doing it now is rather "aggressive" and there might be some edge-cases that I missed (it is surprisingly complex with some missing APIs from GitHub - BTW - I requested those :))

Just a small update - the versions are updated fast :). Some edge cases and bug fixes and we are at 4_7 now (I chose this weekend to implement some refactoring that led to some problems. All of them should be fixed in 4.7 version: https://github.com/marketplace/actions/cancel-workflow-runs :D.

That is Kafka, you could read directly. We are using the Kafka message header to propagate the context, including the trace id.
You have conflicting, please recheck.
What is header's key?

First, if the trace context in the header of Kafka's message is correct, then this is not a bug of SkyWalking and its plugin.
The issue you are facing because of your `@trace` and your codes. 

---
In the SkyWalking, if a segment(consumer in your case) has multiple parents(we call it `reference`), then only the first trace-id left to propagate. Because this is better for performance. If you are using the batch consuming mode, then this is expected, not a bug. If you are not expecting the batch consumption, then it means you put `@trace` at the wrong place.
---

I hope the above explanation is clear enough for you. Actually, this is tracing 101 :)
